scripts.build: for DIR in packages/*; do (cd $DIR && npm run build); done
scripts.preinstall: for DIR in packages/*; do (cd $DIR && npm install); done

scripts.dev: Using 'concurrently' since each of the processes remains running (watching).

concurrently: If we have more components (say, >4), consider 'run-p' that can handle patterns (e.g. 'watch:**').
We're just more familiar with 'concurrently' and it only does one thing - which is nice.
